plugin.comment:
If a model is further away than the LOD reduction distance, it will be reduced to that LOD. So the L1 reduction distance should be really long and the L5 reduction distance should be really short. This means distances should be in descending order, e.g. 5 4 3 2 1.
Note that if we run out of memory or too many models are on screen at once, the engine may reduce models to a lower LOD BEFORE they reach the reduction distance for that LOD.
If a model has a begin fade distance and disappear distance, it will begin fading out at that distance, reaching zero alpha and disappearing at the disappear distance. These distances should be greater than all of the LOD reduction distances.

option.name: Fade At Super High Detail Level
Fade At Super Low Detail Level

tagblock.name: Variants
tagblock.comment: Each index here points to a region in the render model, and each region in the below Regions block points to an index here instead. You want to point to the runtime index containing your actual index.

tagRef.name: Looping Effect
tagRef.tooltip: played while the model is in this state

enum16.name: Sort Order
enum16.tooltip: negative values mean closer to the camera

bit.name: Parent Never Takes Body Damage For Us
Parent Never Takes Shield Damage For Us

float32.name: Minimum Stun Damage
float32.tooltip: the minimum damage required to stun this object's health

float32.name: Stun Time
float32.tooltip: the length of time the health stay stunned (do not recharge) after taking damage

float32.name: Recharge Time
float32.tooltip: the length of time it would take for the shields to fully recharge after being completely depleted

float32.name: Recharge Fraction
float32.tooltip: 0 defaults to 1 - to what maximum level the body health will be allowed to recharge

float32.name: Maximum Shield Vitality
float32.tooltip: the default initial and maximum shield vitality of this object

float32.name: Minimum Stun Damage
float32.tooltip: the minimum damage required to stun this object's shields

float32.name: Stun Time
float32.tooltip: the length of time the shields stay stunned (do not recharge) after taking damage

float32.name: Recharge Time
float32.tooltip: the length of time it would take for the shields to fully recharge after being completely depleted

bit.name: Absorbs Body Damage
bit.tooltip: damage to this section does not count against body vitality

bit.name: Takes Full Damage When Object Dies
Takes Full Damage When Object Destroyed
Headshotable
bit.tooltip: takes extra headshot damage when shot

bit.name: Ignores Shields
bit.tooltip: damage to this section bypasses shields

tagblock.name: Instant Responses
tagblock.comment: * if you specify a constraint group name (see lower section of this block) you can specify a constraint damage * loosening a constraint takes it out of the rigid state - activates it * destroying a constraint sets the attached body free

option.name: Destroy One Of Group
option.tooltip: sets the attached body of this constraint free

option.name: Destroy Entire Group
option.tooltip: sets the attached body of all constraints free

option.name: Loosen One Of Group
option.tooltip: takes this constraint out of the rigid state - activates it

option.name: Loosen Entire Group
option.tooltip: takes all constraints out of the rigid state - activates them

bit.name: Kills Object
bit.tooltip: when the response fires the object dies regardless of its current health

bit.name: Inhibits Melee Attack
bit.tooltip: from halo 1 - disallows melee for a unit

bit.name: Inhibits Weapon Attack
bit.tooltip: from halo 1 - disallows weapon fire for a unit

bit.name: Inhibits Walking
bit.tooltip: from halo 1 - disallows walking for a unit

bit.name: Forces Drop Weapon
bit.tooltip: from halo 1 - makes the unit drop its current weapon

bit.name: Destroys Object
bit.tooltip: when the response fires the object is destroyed

bit.name: Damages Weapon Primary Trigger
bit.tooltip: destroys the primary trigger on the unit's current weapon

bit.name: Damages Weapon Secondary Trigger
bit.tooltip: destroys the secondary trigger on the unit's current weapon

float32.name: Damage Threshold
float32.tooltip: response fires after crossing this threshold. 1=full health

tagblock.comment: If desired, you can specify a delay until the response fires.This delay is pre-empted if another timed response for the same section fires.The delay effect plays while the timer is counting down.If the damage threshold is taken in a single hit while counting down, it will prematurely fire.

- a response can destroy a single constraint by naming it explicitly. - alternatively it can randomly destroy a single constraint from a specified group if the "destroy one group constraint" flag is set - also it can destroy all constraints in a specified group if the "destroy all group constraints" flag is set

stringId.name: Destroyed Child Object Marker Name
stringId.tooltip: when this response fires, any children objects created at the supplied marker name will be destroyed

float32.name: Total Damage Threshold
float32.tooltip: scale on total damage section vitality

stringid.name: Marker Name
stringid.tooltip: multiple markers become multiple spheres of the same radius

degree.name: Cone Angle
degree.tooltip: the target is only visible when viewed within this angle of the marker's x axis

int16.name: Damage Section Index
int16.tooltip: the target is associated with this damage section

int16.name: Variant Index
int16.tooltip: the target will only appear with this variant

float32.name: Targeting Relevance
float32.tooltip: higher relevances turn into stronger magnetisms

tagRef.name: Default Dialogue
tagRef.tooltip: The default dialogue tag for this model (overriden by variants)

stringId.name: Default Dialogue Effect
stringId.tooltip: The default dialogue tag for this model (overriden by variants)

tagblock.name: Scenario Load Parameters
tagblock.comment: strip-variant <variant-name> strips a given variant out of the model tag strip-dialogue strips all the dialogue for this model i.e. cinematic only

tagRef.name: Hologram Shader
tagRef.tooltip: hologram shader is applied whenever the control function from it's object is non-zero
